shortdescription: Welcome to PurePlantParadise â€“ your premier online destination for indoor plants powered by advanced MERN Stack technology for a seamless shopping experience.
Overview: PurePlantParadise features an advanced ecommerce platform developed using the MERN(Mongodb, Express.js, React, Node.js) Stack technology. It offers a seamless experience for indoor plant enthusiasts, allowing customers to effortlessly browse, order, and purchase their favorite greenery. The site includes a user-friendly interface and intuitive design, while the admin dashboard empowers administrators to manage products, categories, and attributes with ease. Additionally, administrators can efficiently handle order management tasks, including updating statuses and fulfilling customer requests. With comprehensive CRUD capabilities and efficient order management functionalities.
keyFeatures: Checkout - One-page Checkout process with online payment.
Filter with fully operate - Search or filter based product.
Catalog Management - with customized attribute and multiple category.
CRUD Operations - Mange order, product, category and attribute.
design: I personally crafted every detail of PurePlantParadise's design, drawing inspiration from various sources and leveraging pre-built components, including some from Shadcn, to personalize the website. Using Figma, I meticulously prototyped and designed the website over the course of 1-1.5 weeks. The design process involved a thorough exploration of layout, color schemes, typography, and imagery to create a visually appealing and user-friendly interface.Every aspect of the design was carefully considered to provide an enjoyable browsing experience for our users. The design of PurePlantParadise reflects my dedication to creating a beautiful and intuitive online shopping environment for indoor plant enthusiasts.
development:
For PurePlantParadise, I utilized the MERN stack to develop the site, ensuring efficiency and scalability. Before diving into code, I meticulously crafted schema relationships for MongoDB, prioritizing stability and minimizing the need for future changes.
	On the frontend, I opted for React with Tailwind CSS for styling, incorporating pre-built components from Shadcn and customizing them to align with my vision. To manage state effectively, I employed Redux for global state management, while leveraging Tanstack Query for asynchronous state management and API refetching. For seamless navigation, React Router Dom handled routing seamlessly.
	Moving to the backend, I leveraged API endpoints to facilitate data flow. Using Mongoose for MongoDB ORM simplified database operations, while Firebase served as the image storage bucket, with URLs converted to store in MongoDB collections. Deployment was streamlined with Netlify handling frontend deployment and Render.com for backend deployment.
